alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Burlington; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 5:16PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Burlington County through 545 PM EDT... At 516 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Medford, or 18 miles east of Camden, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Medford, Lumberton, Mount Holly, Tabernacle, Pemberton, Wrightstown, Browns Mills, Jobstown, Columbus, Leisuretowne, Jacksonville, Medford Lakes, Pemberton Heights, Fort Dix and McGuire AFB. This includes Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 52 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
